snippet: The shows each collected five awards and Kelli O’Hara captured best actress for a musical in “The King and I” at the 69th annual Tony Awards.
abstract: Broadway show Fun Home garners five Tony Awards including best new musical, The Curious Incident of the Dog in the Night-Time wins best new play, Skylight wins best play revival and The King and I wins best musical revival; actress Kelli O'Hara wins Tony after five previous nominations; program stands out from past years by number of awards granted to women, particularly in categories where they have been rarely honored.

byline.original: By MICHAEL PAULSON and PATRICK HEALY

lead_paragraph: The shows each collected five awards and Kelli O’Hara captured best actress for a musical in “The King and I” at the 69th annual Tony Awards.

headline.main: Tony Awards: ‘Fun Home’ Wins Best Musical and ‘Curious Incident of the Dog in the Night-Time’ Best Play
headline.print_headline: ‘Fun Home’ and ‘Curious Incident’ Top the Tonys

keywords.name: creative_works
keywords.value: The Curious Incident of the Dog in the Night-Time (Play)
